DOC.detailed_description: Led Oregon Primary Care Association , three community health center ( CHC ) organization Oregon develop Alternative Payment Methodology ( APM ) . Under APM pilot participate CHCs receive prospective payment system ( PPS ) payment capitated equivalent per-member-per-month rate Medicaid patient . Oregon CHC organization ( several clinic site ) implement Phase I demonstration project March 1 , 2013 ; Phase IIA implementedon July 1 , 2014 ; Phase IIB October 1 , 2014 ; Phase III begin July 1 , 2015 . We prospective analysis APM project sit . We propose use mixed method study process outcomes associate APM natural experiment payment reform . We hypothesize CHCs participate APM demonstration project redesign workflows well focus patient population health need , result reallocation financial resource , low overall cost , change utilization pattern , improve quality . The study include baseline qualitative data collection clinic transition APM methodology . We conduct 2 site visit intervention clinic observe practice change occur post APM-implementation ( first visit approximately 12-18 month post-APM implementation ; second visit approximately 30-36 month post-APM implementation ) . We also assemble analyze pre-post quantitative qualitative datasets , interpretation dissemination study finding .
